0.user_question: John decides to take up an odd hobby of speed talking.  His normally speaking speed is 150 WPM.  After training his speed is 2.5 times faster than his starting speed.  How long would it take him to speak 10 pages if each page has 450 words per page?

direct_answer.text: Firstly we need to calculate John's new speech rate which is 150*2.5=<<150*2.5=375>>375 Words Per Minute (WPM). Next let’s find out all the words required to complete ten full pages; this equals 450*10= <<450*10=4500>>4500 words. And since every minute contains 60 seconds so one second can contain only .0277...words/second=. Seconds needed=(Total Word Count) /(Word Rate)= >>(4500)/(375)=>12 sec. Therefore you don’t even wait until minutes starts counting! But as requested minimum time rounded down to nearest whole minute or any smaller unit like seconds here comes our Final

0.user_question: John decides to take up an odd hobby of speed talking.  His normally speaking speed is 150 WPM.  After training his speed is 2.5 times faster than his starting speed.  How long would it take him to speak 10 pages if each page has 450 words per page?

ost_step.1: John's normal speaking rate was 150 words per minute (WPM).
ost_step.2: Speed talker mode increases this rate by a factor of 2.5, so now we calculate 150 * 2.5 = <<150*2.5=375>>375 WPM.
ost_step.3: Each page contains 450 words which equals about 450 / 375 = 1.2 minutes when spoken at the increased speed of 375 WPM.
ost_step.4: To find out how much time for ten such pages requires just multiplying that value on one side by 10 yielding  1.2 x 10 = 12 minutes needed overall. Answer: \boxed{12}.
